page.title: 13ABBOT HOLME FARM
page.content: In the area there are many traditional Dales hill farms of about 50 acres, with milking cows and grazing sheep forming the main income. Most of everyday is spent working because the animals provide the income and therefore have to be kept alive. Financially the farm is hard to run because the price for the animals is set and paid by external buyers and can differ greatly between two similar animals. To supplement the income of the farm they did try bed and breakfast for a while. But the amount of extra income that this brought in did not justify the work involved. Self-sufficiency is a major factor in small farms; the farmers' families do not travel much beyond Sedbergh and the cattle auction market at Hawes. They use delivery services from local grocery shops.
